sen.j: 黒船（くろふね）は、大型の西洋式航洋船のことで、語としては江戸時代の前から近世の日本で用いられた。
sen.e: Kurofune is a term used to refer to large, Western-style sea vessels, used before the Edo Period until the modern age.
Kurofune is a term used to refer to large, Western-style sea vessels, used before the Edo Period until the modern age.
Kurofune is a term used to refer to large, Western-style sea vessels, used before the Edo Period until the modern age.

sen.j: 今日ではこの時代か、より狭く江戸時代末期にかけて日本に来航した船を指す歴史用語として用いられる。
sen.e: Presently, the term is narrower in definition and is used to the ships that arrived in Japan in the late Edo Period.
The term is presently used to refer to ships that came to Japan during the late Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The term is presently used to refer to ships that came to Japan during the late Edo Period.

sen.j: 特に1853年、浦賀沖に来航したアメリカ合衆国のマシュー・ペリー率いるアメリカ海軍艦隊の事を指す（黒船来航を参照のこと）。
sen.e: It is most closely associated with the fleet of United States Navy ships led by Matthew PERRY that arrived off the coast of Uraga in 1853.
The term is mostly associated with the fleet of United States Navy ships, led by Matthew PERRY, that arrived off the coast of Uraga in 1853.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The term is mostly associated with the fleet of United States Navy ships, led by Matthew PERRY, that arrived off the coast of Uraga in 1853.
Perry Squadron
Perry's squadron
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Perry's squadron

sen.j: 当時の欧米の船はタールで船体を黒色に塗っていたため、黒船と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Western ships in the times of Perry were called "black ships" because of the tar that was applied on the body of the ship.
Western ships of that day were called "black ships" because of the tar that was applied to the body of the ship.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Western ships of that day were called "black ships" because of the tar that was applied to the body of the ship.

sen.j: ペリー艦隊には蒸気船が含まれており、しばしば黒船は蒸気船のことだと考えられるが、帆船も黒船である。
sen.e: The term "black ship" is often believed to be a steamboat because the Perry squadron included a steamboat but actually refers to sailing ships as well.
Because Perry's squadron included a steamship, many associate the term "black ships" with steamships, but it also refers to the sail ships.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Because Perry's squadron included a steamship, many associate the term "black ships" with steamships, but it also refers to the sail ships.

sen.j: 現代では資本主義列強の日本に対する圧力や外資進出などこれまでの常識を覆す存在の代名詞的に用いられることがある。
sen.e: Today, the term is used at times to symbolize external pressure on Japan, such as by capitalist powers, or entry of foreign capital in the country that can destroy existing conventions.
Today, the term is used at times to symbolize external pressure on Japan, such as by capitalist powers, or entry of foreign capital in the country that can destroy existing conventions.
Today, the term is used at times to symbolize external pressure on Japan, such as by capitalist powers, or entry of foreign capital in the country that can destroy existing conventions.

tit.j: 黒船を題材にした映画

sen.j: 黒船（くろふね、原題「THE BARBARIAN AND THE GEISHA（異人と芸者）」）とは、1958年製作のジョン・ヒューストン監督映画の邦題。
sen.e: "The Barbarian and the Geisha," a 1958 film by John Houston, is titled "Kurofune" in Japanese.
"Kurofune" is the Japanese title of a 1958 film by John Houston (Original title: "The Barbarian and the Geisha").
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: "Kurofune" is the Japanese title of a 1958 film by John Houston (Original title: "The Barbarian and the Geisha").

sen.j: 幕末の日米交渉を描いた。
sen.e: The film portrayed the US-Japan trade negotiations that took place at the end of the Edo Period.
The film portrayed the US-Japan trade negotiations that took place at the end of the Edo Period.
The film portrayed the US-Japan trade negotiations that took place at the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 主演：ジョン・ウェイン。
sen.e: John Wayne played the leading role.
John Wayne played the leading role.
John Wayne played the leading role.

sen.j: 日本の京都や奈良でロケが行われた。
sen.e: It was filmed on location in Kyoto and Nara.
It was filmed on location in Kyoto and Nara.
It was filmed on location in Kyoto and Nara.

sen.j: 大相撲力士のKONISHIKI、プロ野球選手のボブ・ホーナー、グラビアアイドルのリア・ディゾン、演歌歌手のジェロのようにアメリカから来日して日本でブームを巻き起こした人物や、日本市場に参入する外国企業、iPhoneのような海外からの新たな商品なども、安定していた業界を席巻し、また業界の秩序自体にも不可逆の変化をもたらし、時には日本側の強い抵抗を引き起こすことなどから、それぞれの業界の黒船と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Important persons who came to Japan from the United States and created a major stir--represented by sumo wrestler KONISHIKI, professional baseball player Bob HORNER, centerfold model Leah DIZON, and enka singer JERO--as well as foreign businesses that entered Japan and new products such as the iPhone, were at times called "Kurofune" in the respective industries for sparking great excitement amid relative peace and stability and at times stimulating strong resistance on the Japanese side.

The term "Kuro-bune (black ship)" is also used for people who come from abroad and create news and/or start a new fad (such as sumo wrestler KONISHIKI, professional baseball player Bob HORNER, centerfold model Leah DIZON, and enka singer JERO), a foreign business that makes a break in the Japanese business market, new products that are brought to Japan from other countries (such as the iPhone), or anything that takes a stable market by storm, bring irreversible changes to a particular market and that at times may receive strong oppositiion from within Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味がよりよく伝わるように訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The term "Kuro-bune (black ship)" is also used for people who come from abroad and create news and/or start a new fad (such as sumo wrestler KONISHIKI, professional baseball player Bob HORNER, centerfold model Leah DIZON, and enka singer JERO), a foreign business that makes a break in the Japanese business market, new products that are brought to Japan from other countries (such as the iPhone), or anything that takes a stable market by storm, bring irreversible changes to a particular market and that at times may receive strong oppositiion from within Japan.
